name: leni
notes:
for pattern support please go to the questions thread [here][1].

**...let me shout out a big thank you for your love, your ongoing support, your trust, your understanding, your patience....for being by my side on this journey.... hope you enjoy this little hat pattern!**


*leni* is a casual hat, worked in the round from the folded brim to the top. combining one strand of mohair lace and one strand of fingering weight merino results in a soft and sumptuous look, but any other yarn that gives you the right gauge will work just fine. the hat is started with a provisional cast on and some ribbing which is then hidden when the main body of the hat is worked. a small delicate band of texture comes next and adds just the right amount of interest. an optional pompom is worked last.

yarn suggestions
first image:
independence street treat yo' self lite (450 yds (411 m)/ 100 g), shown in color weak mouse.
lamana premia (328 yds (300 m)/ 25 g), shown in color #46 basalt blue.
or
second image:
lolabean yarn co. navy bean (400 yds (366 m)/ 100 g), shown in color fountain grass.
walkcollection kidmohair lace (459 yds (420 m)/ 100 g), shown in color blush.
or
third image:
ito rakuda (231 yds (211 m)/ 40 g), shown in color #649 mustard
shibui tweed silk cloud (190 yds (174 m)/ 25 g), shown in color pollen

**both yarns are used held together (yarns could be substituted for a single dk to worsted weight).**

you will need approximately 
200 (220, 238) yds [186 (201, 217) m] of each.
note: yardage includes optional pompom.

needles
us 4 (3.5 mm) circular needle, 16" (40 cm) long for brim.
us 6 (4 mm) circular needle, 16" (40 cm) long and dpns for body.

gauge
21 sts x 32 rows = 4" (10 cm) square in stockinette stitch on larger needle after blocking.

finished measurements
circumference (unstretched): 
18 (19.5, 21)" 
46 (49.5, 53.5) cm
to fit 
20/21.5 (21.5/23, 23/24.5)" 
51/54.5 (54.5/58.5, 58.5/62) cm
height (without pompom): 
8.5" (21.5 cm)

notions
smooth waste yarn and crochet hook for provisional cast on, 8 stitch markers, row counter (optional), tapestry needle, pompom maker or a fake fur pompom (optional), blocking tools.
